title: Can someone give tips on how to play fiora support?
body:
I am pretty certain its playable because if the game go past 40 min, i have a chance of winning with gathering storm and transcendence.
So does anyone know like a certain build or something to survive the laning phase. My parry and my ultamate is not guarnteed so laning phase is tough!

Youre basically guaranteeing a lost lane.  I could maybe possibly somehow see it not being complete garbage if you pick it into something really passive like an enemy ezreal/tahm kench lane, but if the enemy lane is any kind of kill lane you will probably lose lane into lose game.  

Outside of relic shield procs and MAYBE an atk speed slow from your W (b/c youre never gonna land the stun part of it most likely) you provide no utility for your lane, and because fiora wants gold, unless you steal farm you will never scale up to relevance.
I split push, after 20. That one of my champion winning condition. So i think im allowed to do it. Usually my adc dies a lot in laning phase so i have good amount of farm!

Right? that is some hard griefing...  And this is coming from a guy who in ranked when autofilled support has played {{item:3302}} {{champion:91}}  and {{champion:80}} .    Pantheon support works better b/c of W stun, Q poke and the passive blocking turret shots enabling dives.   Talon as a support is a lot more risky, but IMO is still way less of a griefing pick than "fiora support"  b/c talon can zone the enemy botlane (especially if they're both squishy champs) and can hard punish if they over extend with just a W>Q>auto trade so the enemy botlane has to respect your kill lane potential (actually works incredibly well with an {{champion:22}}  adc b/c her slow enables you to hit both parts of W guaranteeing your passive).      Plus {{champion:91}}  E enables him to dip out of lane, ward and come right back, potentially from a flank.


Lol I got a little off topic, but I felt like this was an appropriate thread to discuss 2 of my pretty off meta support picks when i get autofilled :).

Comprehensive guide on how to play Fiora support:

1. Start Spellthief's and take two pots
2. Max out W
3. Remember to poke a lot
4. Keep bushes warded
5. Peel for your ADC, start building for a Redemption
6. Lose game and realize that Fiora has no reliable CC, gets poked down way too hard, at least one teammate got tilted because of your pick and that there is a huge champ pool that would serve better as off-meta supports. 
7. Probably get a 14 day suspension. 
8. On the off-chance you made it to late game, you are depriving your team of much-needed cc and if they have any decent assassins, your ADC is fucked.
14 day suspension..., if teemo can be picked in support why cant fiora be support. I think with good practice with fiora support, fiora can be tied with teemo support!
Easy, get a real support and forget fiora.

Play with friends. The required adjustment in playstyle for random teammates may be to high to expect reasonably. If your unable to provide individual impact consistently (implied heavily by the fact your requesting assistance in doing it better)

With just a duo, you will find Having an "ADC" Run {{item:3302}} would provide sustain and lower your Time to significant item power spikes inherent with {{champion:114}} .
Further you can try swapping out your Bot with a Champion that has a stronger early game impact then traditional ADC classes. There are options for ranged DPS viable in top lane matchups. So with 2 friends you could run ADC top and a Cheese off meta kill lane bot.   I think some reliable DPS with CC would be ideal. {{champion:80}} for example, Plus he could roam using his R at which point Fiora support should snag some CC and scale quicker.

As there are lower options in your usefulness early compaired to a massive # of available options when running this as a support it should be treated as a cheesing strat. You want to abuse a powerspike on your kill potential with Fioras kit + a consistant factor to enable that kill pressure. Duoings the best way to achieve this. 3 players would be better as you can create a comp that accounts for this strategy with a majority of your team and also not create negative impacts by demanding excessively dramatic adjustments to standard player play patterns.

Far as In lane. Learn how to drop Aggro for passive on bad spawns. Walking away to reapply passive in directions you can realistically target will give you a bit more damage and a bit more sustain from using your Q casts to harass.

Your income item should be related to how your planning to lane. 
DO NOT UPGRADE TO T3 ITEMS AS THE STATS ARE SUBPAR FOR THE GOLD. What you want on fiora is going to be better gained from investing that gold elsewhere. T2 is fine, more income, free vision. T3 is a trap, avoid it. Engage off CC for your R and focus on hitting the farthest possible marks, as a champion in bot trys to kite you they will position away. if they cant take your lane in a 100 to 0 attempt they are forced to try and flee towards their tower.  if you can trigger R then you have a very strong zone heal you can fight in and the opponent will need to maneuver away from it.

Body block dramatic CC ability's, strive to parry them, especially if they have long CD {{champion:22}} R for example.

Fiora support will be basically irrelevant the entire game

She has no real engage or tankiness and the best you could do is Q into CC and parry it

So if anything I'd max parry first for shorter CD and try to get a tankier item first instead of tri/BC

Relic shield obviously

Ok, I'll admit I've played some interesting picks in the support role in the past.
{{champion:27}} {{champion:20}} {{champion:32}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:74}} {{champion:83}} {{champion:122}} 

While I'm all for experimentation (so long as it's Normals), there are things out there even I wouldn't play. Fiora is just one of those champions that wasn't designed to be in the Botlane as she's more balanced around being a Solo Laner.

Not saying you're not allowed to play it or that you shouldn't be playing it, but you'd most likely have fun trying something else.

Most of those work simply because they are either tanky and/or have enough CC that even with a limited gold budget they still can perform their jobs. Fiora doesn't have either of those options.

Shaco and Teemo and maybe Heimerdinger are the edge cases, that don't have as clear a path as the rest of your list, but even they still do better than Fiora.
